item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, February 26, 2025 at 12:30 PM UTC
item.description:
1. The FFT Strikes Back: An Efficient Alternative to Self-Attention (83 points | 24 comments)
2. Telescope – an open-source web-based log viewer for logs stored in ClickHouse (64 points | 24 comments)
3. Page is under construction: A love letter to the personal website (140 points | 43 comments)
4. DeepGEMM: clean and efficient FP8 GEMM kernels with fine-grained scaling (325 points | 58 comments)
5. I Went to SQL Injection Court (929 points | 362 comments)
6. Hyperspace (722 points | 370 comments)
7. Iterated Log Coding (49 points | 18 comments)
8. Material Theme has been pulled from VS Code's marketplace (235 points | 164 comments)
9. Part two of Grant Sanderson's video with Terry Tao on the cosmic distance ladder (296 points | 51 comments)
10. A compendium of "open-source" licenses (18 points | 8 comments)
11. Launch HN: Browser Use (YC W25) – open-source web agents (188 points | 77 comments)
12. Terence Tao – Machine-Assisted Proofs [video] (87 points | 11 comments)
13. Understanding Surrogate Pairs: Why Some Windows Filenames Can't Be Read (53 points | 24 comments)
14. Ggwave: Tiny Data-over-Sound Library (199 points | 49 comments)
15. Reflections on 25 Years of Blogging (10 points | 6 comments)
16. The journalists training AI models for Meta and OpenAI (19 points | 11 comments)
17. Hard problems that reduce to document ranking (271 points | 33 comments)
18. Bald eagles are thriving again after near extinction (234 points | 149 comments)
19. Why are QR Codes with capital letters smaller than QR codes with lower case? (235 points | 53 comments)
20. The Deep Research problem (212 points | 84 comments)
21. The XB-70 (2019) (175 points | 107 comments)
22. A CLI to quickly launch VSCode/cursor devcontainers (8 points | 2 comments)
23. Emergent Misalignment: Narrow finetuning can produce broadly misaligned LLMs [pdf] (135 points | 80 comments)
24. Evaluating modular RAG with reasoning models (42 points | 9 comments)
25. Embedding Python in Elixir, it's fine (285 points | 60 comments)
26. Modernist Cuisine: The Art and Science of Cooking (85 points | 61 comments)
27. Chicory: A JVM native WebAssembly runtime (181 points | 78 comments)
28. If it is worth keeping, save it in Markdown (263 points | 185 comments)
29. Gustatory Wisdom: Bruegel the Elder's Twelve Proverbs (1558) (11 points | 3 comments)
30. New maps of the chaotic space-time inside black holes (123 points | 72 comments)
